text_image_relationship.layout_style: Full-page illustration with a central image and minimal text.

color_scheme.color_usage: Gold used for divine figures such as Christ and the halo. Ultramarine provides a rich background, contrasting with the red garments.

features: Central Christ figure flanked by two thieves

drawing_technique.line_style: Fluid pen work with bold outlines
drawing_technique.shading_method: Minimal shading with emphasis on line and color blocks

content_theme.scene_description: Central scene depicting the Crucifixion of Christ. Christ is shown in the middle with a golden halo, wearing a crown of thorns. He is flanked by two thieves, both bound by ropes. A Roman soldier is depicted offering a sponge on a lance. The Gothic architectural frame and richly colored garments draw attention to the central figure of Christ.

technical_features.material: High-quality parchment with smooth surface prepared for rich pigmentation
technical_features.preservation_condition: Excellent color preservation with vivid gold leaf and ultramarine areas intact

analysis.scholarly_interpretation: This manuscript illustration, depicting the Crucifixion of Christ, is an exquisite example of Gothic illumination. The use of ultramarine blue, prized for its rarity and association with divinity, emphasizes the sacred nature of the scene. Gold leaf highlights the divine presence, further accentuated by the architectural framing that resembles Gothic ecclesiastical structures. The centrality and size of Christ, coupled with the halo, situate Him as the focal point, illustrating both His divinity and sacrifice. The Roman soldier's presence and his interaction with Christ through the lance and sponge signify the humanity and suffering of the event, representing theological themes of redemption. This illumination likely served both liturgical and didactic purposes, underscoring the narrative of the Passion for both clergy and laity. The sophisticated artistic techniques and the prestigious materials employed suggest the manuscript's role as both a devotional object and a status symbol, reflecting the wealth and piety of its patron.
